intro: Bellucia pluricaulis, commonly known as the branched bellucia, is a woody shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its multiple stems and opposite leaf arrangement. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
